content: atalia s star by kogi naidoo level beginner materials any worsted/aran weight yarn of your choice in as many or as few colours as you wish 5mm hook sewing needle for working in the ends notes my square measures 12 inches if you find that your square is too large you can replace the last 2 rounds with single_crochet or half_double_crochet instead of double_crochet or if your square is too small you can replace the last 2 rounds with a treble_crochet instead of double_crochet or simply add another round of double_crochet please note however an additional round will result in a different stitch count to mine the instructions are accompanied by photographs you will note that i opted to use a single colour and wrote the instructions accordingly however you are most welcome to use as many colours as you wish i tried a multi-colour square to give you an idea of what it would look like i think i prefer a single colour though i can t wait to see what you decide on there is always something new that you learn regardless of how long you have been crocheting for you will note that i always work half a corner and then close the corner with a half_double_crochet to count as my chain-2 space this is something i learnt from debbie hemsley - you can find her awesome patterns here http //www theneavecollection com/ if you work a full corner at the beginning of the round you will find that your new starting point for the next round is not in the chain-2 space where you want to be to get to the chain-2 space you will have to slip_stitch across 2 sts which may make your work a bit bulky when you close the corner with a half_double_crochet it allows you to start the new round in the same corner-space here is the link for the video tutorial https //www youtube com/watch v=uozk6uqfnpa&feature=youtu be&fbclid=iwar06afzemat6ilo pa86zllzfe6dcjmyoxko_l7aemc2s0xjb80qv_pq8ara 1 abbreviations note this pattern uses us terminology beg beginning beg beginning double ch3 to count as your first double_crochet work another double_crochet in the same dc2togcl crochet two together space or stitch pulling through all loops on the hook to finish cluster note this is different from a typical decrease which is a decrease worked over 2 sts bpdc back post double yo insert your hook from back to front around the post of the crochet stitch from the previous round and work a double_crochet bphdc back post half yo insert your hook from back to front around the post of the double_crochet stitch from the previous round and work a half_double_crochet chain chain double_crochet double_crochet dc2togcl double_crochet two yo and insert hook into the indicated st/space yo and pull up a together cluster loop 3 loops on the hook yo pull through 2 loops yo and insert hook into the same st/space pull up a loop 4 loops on the hook yo and pull through 2 loops 3 loops on
